database.title: SELinux
database.description: Security-Enhanced Linux is a Linux kernel security module that provides a mechanism for supporting access control security policies.
database.enable:
#/system/bin/sh
if [ `getenforce` == "Enforcing" ]; then
echo 1
else
echo 0
fi

database.title: Force Fast Charge mode
database.description:
Disabled
Force AC
Custom mA

database.title: Fast Charge custom current limit
database.description:
Limit max charge current mA
Works if Force Fast Charge in custom mode
[500 900 1200 1500 1800 2000]

database.title: Temperature Throttle
database.description: SoC temperature limit toggle.
database.enable:
#!/system/bin/sh

if [ $(cat /sys/module/msm_thermal/parameters/enable_main) = Y ]
then
  echo 1
else 
  echo 0
fi

database.title: Temperature Limit
database.description: If the temperature goes above, the thermal will throttle the CPU frequency to lower the temperature.

database.apply:
#!/system/bin/sh

chmod "644" /sys/module/msm_thermal/parameters/enable_extreme

if [ $1 -eq 0 ]
then
  echo 1 > /sys/module/msm_thermal/parameters/enable_extreme
else
  echo 0 > /sys/module/msm_thermal/parameters/enable_extreme
fi

chmod "444" /sys/module/msm_thermal/parameters/enable_extreme
database.title: Thermal Shutdown
database.description:
Critical shutdown by SoC temperature threshold.
Disable this only if you using extreme cooling and CPU temp is below zero.
database.enable:
#!/system/bin/sh

if [ $(cat /sys/module/msm_thermal/parameters/enable_extreme) = Y ]
then
  echo 0
else 
  echo 1
fi

database.title: Critical Temperature Threshold
database.description: If the temperature goes above, the thermal will synchronize filesystem and power off. This threshold needs to avoid permanent hardware damage if throttling disabled or it works ineffective by any case.

database.title: Thermal Driver Polling Frequency
database.description:
High values provides more stable thermals while throttling. Low values have lower CPU impact. This value is used only if current SOC temperature up to 15°C below throttling threshold temp. On low temp used: 4Hz.
[Def   4   5   8   10   20   25   40]
Values in Hz.
Select 0 to choose default polling frequency.

database.title: Exponential LCD Backlight Level Control
database.description: Use square function to make backlight brightness change non linear.

database.title: LCD Backlight Min Level
database.description: The minimum available brightness value.

database.title: LCD Backlight Max Level
database.description: The maximum available brightness value.

database.title: LCD Backlight Actual Brightness
database.description: Current screen brightness value.

database.title: LCD Backlight Current
database.description:
Maximum backlight current value. Changing this may be dangerous. Increase this value at your own risk.
Stock: 18.

database.title: Kernel Log Level
database.description: Change the default console log level.

database.title: Torch 2-Step Logic
database.description: Apply custom 2-step logic for torch LED. That allows 2 levels of brightness to be changed on kernel level. Compatible with CM torch apps (that have High Brightness mode).

database.progress:
#!/system/bin/sh

if [ $(cat /sys/class/leds/led:flash_torch/low_brightness) -eq 0 ]; then
  echo 0
  exit
fi

a=$(cat /sys/class/leds/led:flash_torch/low_brightness); let "a = (a - 2) / 13 + 1)"

echo $a
database.title: LED Default Brightness
database.description: Changes the default brightness of the flashlight. Stock: 8. This value can not be higher than High Brightness mode value.

database.progress:
#!/system/bin/sh

if [ $(cat /sys/class/leds/led:flash_torch/max_brightness) -eq 0 ]; then
  echo 0
  exit
fi

a=$(cat /sys/class/leds/led:flash_torch/max_brightness); let "a = (a - 2) / 13 + 1)"

echo $a
database.title: LED High Brightness Mode
database.description: Changes the max brightness of the flashlight. Stock: 12. Using torch at high brightness for long time may cause LED overheat.

database.enable:
#!/system/bin/sh

if [ $(cat /sys/module/max17048_battery/parameters/battery_shutdown) = Y ]
then
  echo 1
else 
  echo 0
fi
database.title: Battery Shutdown
database.description: Disabling this will remove shutdown trigger if battery level is low. However, kernel will power off device at 3.0V to prevent hardware and filesystem damage.

database.title: Disable Battery Temp Control
database.description:
Spoofing of battery temperature and disabling state notification. This is useful if your battery temp reads wrong, in example: swapped battery, damaged cable or used 2-wire connection. In this case controller reads -30°C and battery can not be charged because of Cold health state.
Warning: if this enabled thermal and overvoltage control will be disabled!.
Replug your charger to apply.
database.enable:
#!/system/bin/sh

if [ $(cat /sys/module/max17048_battery/parameters/force_default_temp) = N ]
then
  echo 0
else 
  echo 1
fi

database.apply:
#!/system/bin/sh

a=$1; let "a = (a / 16 + ((a % 16) > 0)) * 16"

if [ $a -lt 3504 ]; then
  echo 3504 > /sys/class/misc/max17048_tweaks/max_voltage_mv
  exit
fi

if [ $a -gt 4400 ]; then
  echo 4400 > /sys/class/misc/max17048_tweaks/max_voltage_mv
  exit
fi

echo $a > /sys/class/misc/max17048_tweaks/max_voltage_mv
database.title: Battery Max Designed Voltage
database.description:
This value should depend on max designed voltage of installed battery. Bad value may cause degradation, fire and explosion of the battery. So set voltage properly.
Replug you charger after changing this.
[Li-ion: 4200mV. Li-poly: 4350-4400mV].
[Nexus 5 BL-T9: 4350mV].

database.title: Battery Designed Capacity
database.description: Set full charge battery capacity mah. Changing this value will not affect on real capacity.

database.title: Battery Precentage Coefficient
database.description:
Fine tune for battery capacity level displayed by the system. Adjust this value at full charge. Wait to update current battery level.
Stock: 19531.

database.title: Disable Dynamic Fsync If Low Battery
database.description: When battery level less than 5% fsync operations is synchronous. Disabling this may cause data loss in case of system crash by too low battery voltage. If disabled critical level battery shutdown or cpu at max load with max display brightness battery voltage can drop below normal values.
database.enable:
#!/system/bin/sh

if [ $(cat /sys/module/max17048_battery/parameters/low_batt_disable_dyn_fsync) = Y ]
then
  echo 1
else 
  echo 0
fi

database.title: CPU Boost: Min Sync Threshold
database.description:
Minimal source CPU frequency to be boosted destination cpu. If frequency lower than this value destination cpu will not boost.
Value in KHz. Set 0 to disable.

database.title: CPU Boost: Load Based Syncs
database.description:
Determine whether the module should react to all task migration events or only to those which maintain task load at least that specified by "Migration Load Threshold".
This switch also changes the way CPU frequencies are going to be changed: when it is disabled, frequencies of source and destination cpus are simply synchronized to a source's one; in case this is enabled, the frequency is changed to either the load fraction of current policy maximum or source's frequency, choosing the biggest of two.
database.enable:
#!/system/bin/sh

if [ $(cat /sys/module/cpu_boost/parameters/load_based_syncs ) = Y ]
then
  echo 1
else 
  echo 0
fi

database.title: CPU Boost: Migration Load Threshold
database.description:
Minimum task load (in precentage) that is considered as noticeable. If a task load is less than this value, frequency synchronization will not occur.
Note that this threshold is used only if "Load Based Syncs" is enabled.

database.title: CPU Boost: Disable Boost When Suspended
database.description: Use state notifier helper to determine state and disable cpu-boost driver when device is suspended. This should help to minimize unnecessary spikes and reduce power consumption when screen is off.
database.enable:
#!/system/bin/sh

if [ $(cat /sys/module/cpu_boost/parameters/disable_while_suspended ) = Y ]
then
  echo 1
else 
  echo 0
fi

database.title: KGSL: Queue Priority
database.description:
The GPU start sequence needs to run with low latency when coming out of slumber for the first draw command. This control changes priority of the start function workqueue.
Greater value = higher priority.
Not recomended to touch this.

database.title: Vibrator Warmup Time
database.description: PWM vibrator timing fine tune. Value in ms.

database.title: Vibrator Driving Time
database.description: PWM vibrator timing fine tune. Value in ms.

database.title: Vibrator Braking Time
database.description: PWM vibrator timing fine tune. Value in ms.

database.title: Vibration Test Pulse
database.description: Select value to test your fine tune PWM vibrator settings. Value in ms.
